text: NEW: For weeks leading up to the publication of Bob Woodward’s latest book “Rage,” West Wing aides were chatting about how damaging some of President Donald Trump’s quotes would be. https://t.co/uaTm0txdyO

name: thedailybeast
text: “It’s been known for a while that this was going to be something that…needed some dealing-with,” one of the officials told The Daily Beast. “The anticipation was that it would probably be worse than the other [earlier] Woodward book.” https://t.co/uaTm0txdyO

name: thedailybeast
text: President Trump was “ecstatic” about the prospect of sitting for interviews with Woodward, who he spoke with 18 times for the book–until he became convinced that Woodward was using him. https://t.co/uaTm0txdyO

name: thedailybeast
text:
The president’s response? Rage-tweeting. 

“The Bob Woodward book will be a FAKE, as always, just as many of the others have been,” Trump tweeted. https://t.co/uaTm0txdyO

name: thedailybeast
text:
The damage done by “Rage” was apparent mere moments after the first stories about the book were published, with the White House scrambling to lay out a coherent defense.

Among those blamed for the decision of sitting with Woodward was Sen. Lindsey Graham. https://t.co/uaTm0txdyO
